questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14509

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

December, 6th 

Thanks to Birmingham's time management techniques course, I now have more realistic goals and know how to use time effectively. So, I believe I will be less busy and less stressed but more productive and more organized. I have a recipe for success. Here are my decisions for a new start:

Mon: I am going to list my tasks in order of importance. Then, I am going to start keeping a to-do list with deadlines.

Tue: I am going to clean my room and tidy my desk. I am going to remove the games on my smartphone. I am going to try to say 'no' to all-time wasters.

Wed: I am going to make a timetable and plan regular breaks to refresh my mind.

Thu: I am going to read books to learn from mistakes and to think positively. I am not going to take a negative attitude towards failure anymore.

Fri: I am going to work out in a gym near my house at 3 p.m. on Fridays.

Sat & Sun: A refreshing weekend with my books and friends...

What is the best option for Adam to be successful?

A) to refresh his mind
B) to plan his time
C) to learn from mistakes
D) to tidy the study area
E) to say 'no' to all time-wasters
A B C D E

question:
December, 6
sup
th
Thanks to Birmingham's time management techniques course, I now have more realistic goals and know how to use time effectively. So, I believe I will be less busy and less stressed but more productive and more organized. I have a recipe for success. Here are my decisions for a new start:

Mon: I am going to list my tasks in order of importance. Then, I am going to start keeping a to-do list with deadlines.

Tue: I am going to clean my room and tidy my desk. I am going to remove the games on my smartphone. I am going to try to say 'no' to all-time wasters.

Wed: I am going to make a timetable and plan regular breaks to refresh my mind.

Thu: I am going to read books to learn from mistakes and to think positively. I am not going to take a negative attitude towards failure anymore.

Fri: I am going to work out in a gym near my house at 3 p.m. on Fridays.

Sat & Sun: A refreshing weekend with my books and friends...

What is the best option for Adam to be successful?

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14512

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Gizem, Huseyin and Ali are English teachers from different cities, but they are going to meet in İstanbul for a seminar on 10th October. Gizem and Hüseyin are going to take the bus to İstanbul, but Ali is going to take the train. They are going to stay at a 5-star hotel in Harbiye for 5 days. It will be a different experience for them because they are going to prepare questions for the students countrywide. They are going to work from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Every day after work, they are planning to do different activities in İstanbul. For example, Ali and Huseyin are going to go to a football match in Dolmabahce on Wednesday. Gizem has a different plan for the same day. She is going to meet some of her friends from university. They are planning to see the perfect view of İstanbul from the Sapphire Tower. She meets her old friends whenever she comes to İstanbul. Huseyin wants to take a city tour on Thursday. Ali is going to visit the Topkapi Palace and take some photos. On Friday evening, they are going to take a boat tour altogether. 15th October is their last day in İstanbul. They are going to finish work and leave the hotel at noon. They are looking forward to working together and having a wonderful time in İstanbul, the city of dreams.

Which of the following is the best title for the paragraph?

A) An Amazing Holiday
B) Work Work Work!
C) Istanbul 'The City of Dreams'
D) A Busy Week in Istanbul
E) Winter in Istanbul
A B C D E

Dear Martin,

I am here in Madrid. I am very excited because I am starting my new job on Monday. My boss has already given me a monthly plan. I am going to search about the disease in some African countries with a group of people. We are going to set off tomorrow morning. The first destination is the Gambia. A guide is going to meet us at the airport. After staying 6 days there, we are going to fly to Togo. Nobody is going to meet us there. Ten days later we are going to leave for the last country, Nigeria. I hope to find useful things for humans.

Best regards

Vicky

We understand from the text that ...... 

A) Vicky is going to earn a lot of money from this job.
B) Vicky is going to visit three countries for this research.
C) Vicky is going to stay longer in Togo than Nigeria.
D) Vicky's boss is not a kind man.
E) somebody is going to meet Vicky and his friends in Nigeria.
A B C D E

2. You remember that it is your parents’ wedding anniversary today.

     b. I will throw them a surprise party.

3. Your friends invite you for lunch but you don’t have enough money.

      b. I’m going to refuse to go with them.

        a.I think it will rain.

        b.I think it is going to rain.

A) 1a - 2b - 3b - 4a
B) 1a - 2b - 3b - 4b
C) 1b - 2a - 3b - 4a
D) 1a - 2b - 3a - 4b
E) 1a - 2a - 3a - 4b
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the following statement according to the dialogue.

Interviewer: Hello, Mr. Jones. Welcome to our programme! As far as we know, you worked for a company for many years as the CEO, and you have just retired. Can we learn your plans for the future?

Mr. Jones: First of all, I want to thank you for inviting me here. At this stage of my life, I have some plans for the future. Firstly, I’m going to spend more time with my children. Because of hard work, I think I didn’t take care of my children enough. The older you get, the more you realize how wrong that is. Then I’m going to study philosophy at the university. It was the biggest dream of my youth, but I never had time to fulfill it before. Now, I’m retired, and I’m going to make it real as soon as possible.

We understand from the dialogue that Mr Jones ­­...... .

A) regrets not giving enough time to his kids
B) doesn't have a strong desire to make his dreams come true
C) feels sorry for quitting his job
D) has no time to fulfill his dreams
E) feels anxious about the future of his children
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14577

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

I was on my way home from a visit to my daughters in Texas when I heard on the radio that Hurricane Katrina was about to hit Mississippi and Louisiana. When I got home, I checked the Internet to get specific information. I learned that Hurricane Katrina would hit on Monday morning, August 29th, 2005. By Monday at 6.30 a.m., Hurricane Katrina hit. There was a terrible storm. All the phone lines went dead. Nearly 3,000 people, including me, had to go to the hospital because of injuries by Katrina on that day. The first floor of the hospital started flooding. The power went off. We couldn't drink the water because it was poisonous. All of a sudden, water came into the room through the windows. There were bad injuries as the windows were broken, and the furniture crashed into people. Outside the hospital was also terrible. All the power lines and trees were down. The trees blocked the highways. Nobody was able to pass the roads. Everybody was really terrified. I had to stay in hospital till the following Monday. It was the most terrifying week of my life.

The reason why they couldn't drink water after the hurricane was that ...... .

A) they weren't thirsty
B) the water was poisonous
C) the water wasn't tasty
D) they were hungry
E) the weather was very cold
A B C D E

The trees blocked the highways. Nobody was able to pass the roads. Everybody was really terrified. I had to stay in hospital till the following Monday. It was the most terrifying week of my life. The reason why they couldn't drink water after the hurricane was that ...... . A) they weren't thirsty B) the water was poisonous C) the water wasn't tasty D) they were hungry E) the weather was very cold A B C D E

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

An interviewer, Jenny, asked some questions to Mr. Max about the harmful effects of horror films on young people yesterday. He said that such effects were very bad for them and claimed that other types of films were more dangerous for them. He declared that horror films were often set in unreal situations and were not serious. He meant that they were not real. On the other hand, he claimed that films showing violent crime were often set in everyday life and therefore more damaging.

Mr. Max thinks that ...... .

A) horror films were more damaging than films showing violent crime films
B) the films including violent crime were worse than horror films for kids
C) the horror films were more enjoyable than other types of films
D) children should watch violent crime films instead of horror films
E) only adults could watch horror films
A B C D E

Yesterday was one of the darkest and the coldest winter days. I decided to go walking in the park. While I was walking in the park, I heard a woman scream. Suddenly, I ran towards the sound. When the police came, they first thought the killer was me. In the end, they understood that I only helped her.

Which of the following cannot be the title for the text?

A) The Worst Day
B) A Brave Man
C) A Bad Adventure
D) A Sunny Day
E) A Poor Woman
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Hi Tracey,

I am back from a long journey on two continents. They are Europe and America. I went on this journey to see the world's 5 greenest countries. The journey was amazing. I came back with lots of unforgettable memories and photos. Of course, everything was not perfect during the journey. I had some problems, as well. For example, I broke one of my toes while climbing a small mountain in Switzerland. It hurt a lot and no one was there to give me a hand. I felt desperate. After some time in the forest, I saw a beautiful hut. There was a married couple in it. They gave me a bed and took care of me for two days. When my toe was OK, I kept walking in the green mountains. Anyway, you are going to see all the photos soon.

Big Hugs

John

We cannot infer from the text that ...... .

A) the writer came back home after a long journey
B) the writer visited five different continents
C) the writer gained unforgettable memories after his journey
D) the writer injured himself during the journey
E) according to the writer, everything was not perfect
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14599

Which question does not have an answer in the paragraph?

The Dog and the Bone

A dog was holding a juicy bone in his jaws while he was crossing a bridge over a brook. When he looked down into the water, he saw another dog below. It was holding a bigger and juicier bone. He wanted to have it, jumped into the brook to snatch the bigger bone and let go of his own. He quickly learned, of course, that the bigger bone was just a reflection, and so, he ended up with nothing to eat.

A) What was the dog doing when he saw another dog with a bigger bone?
B) Why did the dog let go of his own bone?
C) Was the dog with a bigger bone real?
D) How big was the bone in the brook?
E) Why did the dog want to jump into the river?
A B C D E

B) Europeans didn't have any buildings with air conditioners before 2003, but they equipped them with air conditioners in the last 50 years.
C) Air conditioners were not in the European buildings 50 years ago, but it is possible to see them equipped with air conditioners since 2003.
D) A small number of European buildings were not equipped with air conditioners before 2003, but there were no air conditioners fifty years ago.
E) European buildings were mostly equipped with air conditioners fifty years ago though most were built before 2003.
A B C D E

In 1970, at 3.23 p.m., while many of the residents of Yungay were listening to the last minutes of the World Cup Soccer Game, the Ancash region and half of Peru were struck by a huge earthquake. It was the Ancash earthquake (also called the Great Peruvian earthquake), and the areas around Peru were also seriously affected. Besides, the earthquake triggered one of the most devastating avalanches in the past. Nearly 20,000 people were killed because of the avalanche, and a reporter said, "Yungay no longer exists, only 92 people survived''.

The Peruvian earthquake .......

A) shook all Peru but Ancash region
B) happened when the soccer game had just started
C) is also called the Ancash earthquake
D) killed 92 people
E) was the result of an avalanche
A B C D E

E) 1 - 3 - 5 - 4 - 2
A B C D E

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the dialogue.

Bill: When I was a child, my grandfather used to tell me wonderful stories. I wish I could remember them.  If I remember them, I will tell them to my children.

Alice: Yes, dear. Unfortunately, you can’t. I remember when you told me the story about the lion that wants to be a human. You confused the whole story.

Bill: Oh, yes! It was one of the hardest stories, and my memory is weak. When a story is full of adventures like that one, I can never be sure what happened first.

Alice: Maybe, it would be better to read stories to the kids from storybooks.

It’s understood from the dialogue that ......

A) Alice likes listening to stories that Bill tells her.
B) Bill wants to read good stories to his grandchildren.
C) Bill's grandfather wasn’t the best storyteller in the family.
D) Bill is having trouble remembering the chronological order of the events in stories.
E) Alice is trying to be a good friend and not hurt Bill’s feelings about his grandfather.
A B C D E

Marco and Stefano moved to London and didn’t have any friends. To meet their neighbours, they decided to invite them for dinner. Marco wanted to impress the neighbours with an easy Italian pasta with olive oil and garlic sauce. First, he cooked the pasta in boiling water for about 8 minutes. Next, he heated the olive oil in a pan. Then, he put some garlic in the oil and cooked them until they softened. After he drained the pasta, he mixed it with the sauce. Finally, he served the pasta with some parmesan cheese.

What did Marco do before serving the pasta?

A) He asked for help from Stefano.
B) He cooked onions and boiled some water.
C) He cooked some vegetables and mixed them with the garlic oil.
D) He called his neighbours and told them that the dinner was ready.
E) He mixed the pasta with the sauce and put some parmesan cheese on it. 
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Which of the following is the correct order of the sentences in the paragraph?

(I)Then, we kept red meat, sugar, and oily food out of our kitchen. (II) Finally, we started jogging in the mornings for about 20 minutes, and we already feel much healthier than last month. (III) At first, it seemed very difficult to go with, but as we kept watching, we changed our minds. (IV) We started a diet that is high in fruits, vegetables and whole grains. (V) When we learned about the positive effects of healthy food and an active lifestyle on our overall health, we thought we should start immediately. (VI) Last month, we watched an amazing documentary about healthy eating habits for a healthy lifestyle.

A) I – II – III – IV – V – VI
B) III – I – V – VI – II – IV
C) VI – III – V – IV – I – II
D) III – V – I – II – VI – IV
E) VI – II – V – IV – I – III
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14572

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Izz Schind was born in Mexico. He started his career as an insurance agent, tried gold mining, worked for a company as a sales director and later became a detective. He got his first job in San Francisco and enjoyed researching mysterious events. This led him to a new position in New York National Detective Agency as an office manager. Schind spent most of his time solving the murder of Sir Gawain Johnson. He was the mayor of New York at that time and was found dead at his home. Nobody knew the reasons for his death and witnessed the event. This made the incident more and more complex. However, Schind managed to find the suspects of his murder. He used various methods to solve this event. And most of the methods he used at that time were used for the first time. This made him famous all around America.

It is clear in the passage that Izz Schind ...... .

A) liked researching everything
B) tried various jobs before becoming a detective
C) started his career to become a detective
D) spent time with Sir Gawain Johnson
E) was found dead at home
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14579

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart lived between 1756 and 1791. He was born in Salzburg, Austria in 1756. His family was musical. His father, Leopold was a composer and a violin teacher. His sister was also a good musician. Young Mozart never went to school. Instead, his father taught him at home. He was very clever and his favorite subjects were Maths and Music. Mozart learned to play keyboards when he was just three and he composed music for the piano at the age of five. He wrote his first full symphony when he was nine years old. He was only twelve when he completed his first full opera. He gave a lot of concerts with his father and sister between the ages of six and seventeen.

We cannot infer from the text that ...... .

A) Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart was middle-aged when he died
B) his family was fond of music
C) when Mozart was at school, his favorite subjects were Maths and Music
D) he was only three years old when he could play keyboards
E) Mozart gave some concerts when he was too young
A B C D E

Yesterday was one of the darkest and the coldest winter days. I decided to go walking in the park. While I was walking in the park, I heard a woman scream. Suddenly, I ran towards the sound. When I came closer to the woman, I saw that the woman was lying on the ground unconsciously. I tried to help her, but I decided to call the ambulance and the police. Fortunately, I did it. When the police came, they first thought the killer was me. In the end, they understood that I only helped her.

Which of the following cannot be the title for the text?

A) The Worst Day
B) A Brave Man
C) A Bad Adventure
D) A Sunny Day
E) A Poor Woman
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the dialogue.

Jamie: In your opinion, ......?

Sarah: Hmm. Let me think. You know women used to wear corsets under their dresses to show that they had slim bellies in the 19th century in America and Europe.

Jamie: Yes, you’re right. Those corsets frequently restricted breathing. Anything else?

Sarah: If I’m not wrong, women used to wear hobble skirts, which were so tight around the ankles that women could only walk with the tiniest steps. And, of course, there are similar examples in many cultures. I remember the tradition of binding the feet of female children to keep them short, which survived in China until the beginning of the 20th century.

Jamie: And I guess many of the super-high-heeled shoes, which women wear today, fall into this category.

A) what did men use to wear in the 19th century
B) is today’s fashion better than the one in the past
C) what are the worst fashions of recent times
D) what was the turning point in fashion history
E) what used to be the most uncomfortable fashion in history
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52694

Which of the following is not stated in the dialogue?

Diana: Our presentation is about the pros and cons of traditional roles in the family. I’ll talk about the pros, and Jason will talk about the cons. So, on the positive side, the roles are very clearly defined; both the man and woman know who does what. So, there is less confusion. The woman has time to manage things about the household chores while the man earns money to support the family.  Over to you, Jason.

Jason: Thank you, Diana. So, on the negative side, if the man is always the one who works, there can be little contact between the father and the children. Also, in some couples, the woman is good at tasks traditionally done by men, or vice-versa. I mean a woman might be better at fixing a car whereas a man might be better at cooking. Finally, and probably most importantly, women want to work and make a career, both for satisfaction and independence, and also to be role models for their children.

A) In some cases, couples can change their roles.
B) To avoid confusion, it is good to define the roles.
C) Spouses should share household chores equally.
D) In traditional families, all members depend on the father for financial support.
E) The teens are talking about the advantages and disadvantages of traditional roles in a family.
A B C D E
questionText: Which of the following is not stated in the dialogue? Diana: Our presentation is about the pros and cons of traditional roles in the family. I’ll talk about the pros, and Jason will talk about the cons. So, on the positive side, the roles are very clearly defined; both the man and woman know who does what. So, there is less confusion. The woman has time to manage things about the household chores while the man earns money to support the family.  Over to you, Jason. Jason: Thank you, Diana. So, on the negative side, if the man is always the one who works, there can be little contact between the father and the children. Also, in some couples, the woman is good at tasks traditionally done by men, or vice-versa. I mean a woman might be better at fixing a car whereas a man might be better at cooking. Finally, and probably most importantly, women want to work and make a career, both for satisfaction and independence, and also to be role models for their children. A) In some cases, couples can change their roles. B) To avoid confusion, it is good to define the roles. C) Spouses should share household chores equally. D) In traditional families, all members depend on the father for financial support. E) The teens are talking about the advantages and disadvantages of traditional roles in a family. A B C D E
question:
Which of the following is not stated in the dialogue?
Diana: Our presentation is about the pros and cons of traditional roles in the family. The woman has time to manage things about the household chores while the man earns money to support the family.  Over to you, Jason.
Jason: Thank you, Diana. So, on the negative side, if the man is always the one who works, there can be little contact between the father and the children. Also, in some couples, the woman is good at tasks traditionally done by men, or vice-versa. I mean a woman might be better at fixing a car whereas a man might be better at cooking. E) Unfortunately,  I usually get poor marks.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14591

Answer the following question according to the e-mail.

Hi Tracey,

I am back from a long journey on two continents. They are Europe and America. I went on this journey to see the world's 5 greenest countries. The journey was amazing. I came back with lots of unforgettable memories and photos. Of course, everything was not perfect during the journey. I had some problems, as well. For example, I broke one of my toes while climbing a small mountain in Switzerland. It hurt a lot and no one was there to give me a hand. I felt desperate. After some time in the forest, I saw a beautiful hut. There was a married couple in it. They gave me a bed and took care of me for two days. When my toe was OK, I kept walking in the green mountains. Anyway, you are going to see all the photos soon.

Big Hugs

John

What do you advise John?

A) You shouldn't travel to too many continents.
B) You should take photos during your journey.
C) You shouldn't travel alone especially when you are in nature.
D) You shouldn't have unforgettable memories.
E) You shouldn't send me messages.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Read the text and find the main idea.

It is a fact that doing household chores is a vital part of life. Even if most people do not like them, they know that they must do them. In modern societies, there is close cooperation in the household chores in families. Therefore, everyone should do almost all the household chores. Especially, women expect their children and husband to contribute in some way to family life. Some children do household chores every day or week. Research studies also show that children become happier when they have the idea that they are an important part of their family. Everyone in the family should have tasks and they should see them as a responsibility, not as a trouble.

A) Only women are responsible for the household chores in a family.
B) In modern societies, children should not do household chores.
C) Everyone should be responsible for every household chore in a family.
D) Research studies show that children get sad when they do household chores.
E) Household chores should be seen as trouble because they are bad.
A B C D E

One day you want to go to the shopping centre with your friend. When you come closer to the shopping centre, your friend decides to park his car in front of a no parking traffic sign. In order to warn him, you say:
options: Don't you see the traffic sign? It says there is roadwork ahead.
You shouldn't park here because it is for disabled people.
You mustn't park here; it is forbidden.
Next time don't park your car here; otherwise, the police will fine you.
You shouldn't park in forbidden areas.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14809

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Eid al–Fitr is 'the festival of breaking the fast' and it marks the end of the fasting month of Ramadan during which Muslims keep away from all or some kinds of food, drink and desires during the day. It is celebrated for three days, and on the morning of the first day, Muslims gather for prayer. The starting day varies every year. In some countries, the prayers take place outside, while others are hosted in mosques or large halls. People visit relatives, friends and sometimes graveyards to pray for their dead. Some people wear clothes from their culture, while others have something new to wear.

Which question does not have an answer in the passage?

A) What is Eid al-Fitr?
B) How do people celebrate Eid al-Fitr?
C) What do people eat for Eid al-Fitr?
D) How do people dress for Eid al-Fitr?
E) When does Eid al-Fitr begin?
A B C D E

In Turkey, national festivals are celebrated in cities and towns with the participation of cultural dancers. Drums and zurnas are played in the celebrations. In Anatolia, small towns have their own folk dances, but in big cities like İstanbul or Ankara, ceremonies turn into a festival of folk dancing. Also, in many places on national holidays, wrestling matches or races are held after the official ceremonies.

A) different folk dances are shown
B) matches are held but races are not
C) drums are played after dance shows
D) fests are only celebrated by dancers
E) official ceremonies are not organised
A B C D E

Choose the correct statement according to the paragraph.

‘Holi’ is a religious festival that welcomes the spring and celebrates the positive energy of the new season.  It is held in India annually and also known as ‘Festival of Colours’ worldwide. It promotes friendship and brotherhood by bringing people together. People prefer wearing white clothes during the fest. They colour each other with dry powder and coloured water to see the magnificence of the colours. They sing and dance under the clouds of colours and have some wonderful time.

A) People wear white clothes so that they can see the colours on them.
B) Indians describe this event as ‘a triumph of the good over evil’.
C) Timing of the festival depends on the movements of the moon.
D) All colours have their symbolic meanings for Indians.
E) Indians celebrate this festival once every two years.
A B C D E

Are you ready to write the ingredients? Here they are: two eggs, one cup of sugar, one cup of flour, six tablespoons of cocoa powder, two teaspoons of baking powder, two teaspoons of vanilla, two thirds cup of milk, two thirds cup of butter and some chocolate chips. You know the steps. First, beat the eggs with sugar. Next, add flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, vanilla and milk. Then, add the melted butter and chocolate chips. Mix all the ingredients. Finally, bake at 180 °C for 30 minutes, but don't forget to preheat the oven. Bon appetite.

A) My Shopping List
B) How to Make a Cake
C) How to Order a Cake
D) My Favourite Food
E) What to Eat in Winter to Be Healthy
A B C D E

Jill: Oh, I’m really sorry. Have you seen the doctor?

Wilma: No, not yet.

Jill: If I were you, I would immediately call the doctor for an appointment.

B) I wish you ate healthy food.
C) I wish you started doing exercises.
D) I wish you were healthy and here with us.
E) I wish you drank at least 3 litres of water.

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Today, I got up at 6 as usual. It was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. It was the third day of the excavation, and we did quite a lot today. We realised how tired we were when we sat for lunch. It wasn't a big lunch, just a piece of toast and coffee. In the afternoon, we continued our routine work; digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day, as it always is, so I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep. Bye for now!

According to the passage, the author .......

A) always gets up early
B) sometimes goes to bed late
C) never has breakfast
D) dislikes drinking coffee in the morning
E) is working in an office
A B C D E

Tomorrow will be a tough day, as it always is, so I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep. Bye for now! If you're working outside in the sun, ...... . A) you should plan duties of the next day B) you have to drink lots of water C) you must go to bed very early D) you have to have salty and juicy food E) you can continue your routine work A B C D E
question:
Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.
Today, I got up at 6 as usual. It was a foggy morning, so I sipped my coffee enjoying the scenery outside the tent. I had some salty and juicy food for breakfast as I got dehydrated in the boiling sun yesterday. You have to drink gallons of water to cool down if you're working outside in the sun. In the afternoon, we continued our routine work; digging the soil, cleaning the recovered artefacts and numbering the pieces. While dining, we planned the next day's duties. Tomorrow will be a tough day, as it always is, so I'm going to bed early and listening to music to get relaxed before falling asleep. Bye for now!
If you're working outside in the sun, ...... .
options: you should plan duties of the next day
you have to drink lots of water
you must go to bed very early
you have to have salty and juicy food
you can continue your routine work

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52744

Choose the correct statement to complete the sentence below according to the paragraph.

I am grateful to the English author Horace Walpole, my hero, for introducing the word serendipity to us. In one of his letters, which he had more than 3000, he stated “this discovery, indeed, is almost of that kind which I call serendipity, a very expressive word.” Like he said, the word itself came to him by serendipity. He formed the word on an old name for Sri Lanka, Serendip. Horace explained that this name was a part of the title of a Persian fairy tale, named The Three Princes of Serendip. While the three noblemen were travelling in the tale, they were always making discoveries by means of accidents and insight. They were not looking for these discoveries, actually. One of the most remarkable examples of this accidental wisdom was the discovery of the beggar boy who would be King Sharanan.

The narrator of the paragraph indicates that Horrace Walpole ...... .

A) searched for the word serendipity
B) was the man who formed the word serendipity
C) thought too much to form the word serendipity
D) discovered many new words in his numerous writings
E) was the author who wrote Persian history accidentally
A B C D E

Jane is the most punctual person.

Hans is more punctual than Leo.

question:
Answer the following question according to the paragraph.
Bill Gates lives in New York. He has a mansion. His mansion has a normal-sized gate, but he has many computers in his house to control many things. There are sensors under the floors. Xanadu 2.0 is the nickname of Bill Gates' house. When he is in his car, he can fill his bath with water and control the temperature. The room darkens automatically when he leaves. He jumps into the pool, and the music starts playing under the water. Pictures change automatically because they are digital. According to many people, the house is awesome.
Which of the following is true about Xanadu 2.0?
options: It has a lot of rooms.
The room darkens when it is noon.
It hasn't got a bathroom or pool.
There are digital images in the house.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 14876

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Most of the countries are planning to prohibit the use of cars that use fossil fuels. They are planning to use only electric cars in the upcoming years because of a variety of reasons. First of all, electric cars are cleaner in terms of environmental issues. They use electric motors, so they are safer and quieter than current fossil-fueled vehicles. While electric cars seem a bit expensive today, they consume less than other types of cars in the long term. As a result, it is more reasonable to buy an electric car in the near future.

It is logical to buy an electric car because ...... .

 

A) many countries advise using fossil-fueled cars
B) it is quite expensive to use electric energy today
C) you can't fix it easily when it breaks down
D) it has a variety of advantages over other types of cars
E) it uses much more fuel than fossil-fueled cars
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Find the irrelevant sentence in the paragraph.

(I) Pygmies are the African people who live in a huge area of Central Africa. (II) They are known for their average height, which is unusually short. (III) They hunt, fish, and gather in the rainforests during the day. (IV) Homer was the first to write about Pygmies in his book 'Illiad'. (V) They also make tools, huts and their own medicines.

A) I
B) II
C) III
D) IV
E) V
A B C D E

Soru 1: 14989

Which of the following can be said according to the given situation?

Your best friend is playing with the fidget spinner. Although she looks so happy with the toy, it makes you angry. To stop her, you say:

A) Three-sided fidget spinners are bigger and more exciting.
B) A spinner is produced to relax people, but it is annoying me now.
C) The colour of your fidget spinner is very nice. Please, buy one for me.
D) My brother has got a fidget spinner, as well. He gets so happy with it.
E) I don't like fidget spinners. Nearly all the people in the streets have a spinner.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52755

Find the closest meaning to the underlined statement below.

Hello! I’m Celine from Canada. I’m a student at university. I enjoy shopping, but I don’t have much money to buy a coat in winter and to buy a t-shirt in summer because clothes are very expensive during the seasons. So, I generally buy most of my clothes during out-of-season sales. I advise everyone to do that. But, when I am shopping till the sunset, it’s tiring as I generally shop till I drop. However, it’s great when I take the best advantage of discounts. Last week, I bought a laptop, but unfortunately the second-hand laptop I bought last month is a real lemon. Because, it’s the second time it's broken down in a month.

‘shop till I drop’ means ...... .

A) enjoying shopping very much
B) getting very tired of shopping
C) hating shopping
D) shopping for a long time in a day
E) getting up early for shopping
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52757

Answer the question according to the paragraph.             

People used to go to work mostly on foot. Today, people prefer going to work by means of different kinds of transportation. There used to be slow trolley-buses in certain cities in the past. Today, there are fast cars.

There used to be a roundabout in almost every town. There are many junctions in big cities today. There used to be a lot of trees in cities in the past. There are high buildings in cities instead of trees. The buildings were used to be low in the past. There didn’t use to be many kinds of things to buy in the past. There are a lot of things to buy today.

Which option is true according to the text?

A) People used to use fast trolley-buses in the past.
B) The cars are faster today than they were in the past.
C) People use only fast cars to go to work today.
D) There were junctions in big cities in the past.
E) People go to work mostly on foot today.
A B C D E

D) There were junctions in big cities in the past. E) People go to work mostly on foot today. A B C D E
